page.title: 14SCHOOLS
page.content: There are two schools in 'D' Block, a playgroup held in the old village school and a primary school.Both of these are in Kirklevington Village.The old school was built in{1857}at a cost of{Â£62.}The money came from the William Hall charity and a cottage was built for the headteacher on a site that was once a carpenters shop and a pig sty. This school was used until Kirklevington village grew in size in the early{1970's,}it took 2-13 yr olds who were taught in one large room which was heated by a coke boiler. Everyone walked to school and sandwiches were brought for lunch until a canteen was built. In summer {1973}the new school took the first of its 130 pupils. The building was extended in{1980.}In{1985}there are five teachers and eight non-teaching staff.
